questions.explanation:
What Hurts The Most.

	Rascal Flatts became the fourth group to have this song on their album. It was written by Jeffrey Steele and Steve Robson. In 2006, Rascal Flatts recorded the song onto their "Me and My Gang" CD and it became their sixth number one song on billboard charts. A record of songs played for the year of 2006 showed that "What Hurts The Most" had become the most played song of that year and was the number one ringtone of 2006.

Bless the Broken Road.

	"Bless the Broken Road" was performed by Rascal Flatts on the CBS show "Yes, Dear". It was written and performed by the Nitty Gritty Dirt Band and performed by four other singing sensations before making it big with Rascal Flatts. They won a Grammy Award for best country song in 2004.

Mayberry.

	For their second album called "Melt", Rascal Flatts sang a country song called "Mayberry". It was the third song released on the album "Melt" and went to number one on the Country Billboard charts.

While You Loved Me.

	"While You Loved Me" was the fourth song released on Rascal Flatts' self-titled album. The song reached number one on the Country Billboard charts and went to number sixty on the U.S. charts.

Life Is A Highway.

	Rascal Flatts performed "Life is a Highway" for the soundtrack of the Disney Pixar movie "Cars". It was originally released as a pop song by Tom Cochrane. In 1998, Chris LeDoux brought it to country music when he released it on his "One Man Road" album. Rascal Flatts took the song to number seven on the Country Billboard charts.

To Make Her Love Me.

	"To Make Her Love Me" was an unreleased song on the Rascal Flatts' album "Me and My Gang".

The Day Before You.

	"The Day Before You" was an unreleased song on Rascal Flatts' second album titled "Feels Like Today".

These Days.

	Rascal Flatts went to number one on the country music charts with the first song from their second album "Melt". It was the only song to be released from the group in 2002.

Pieces.

	Rascal Flatts didn't release "Pieces" as a single from their 2005 album "Me and My Gang", but it went to number 57 on the Country Billboard chart.

Fast Cars and Freedom.

	As the first song released in 2005 from Rascal Flatts' "Fast Cars and Freedom" went to number one on the Country Billboard chart. It was followed up by the popular song about the real life story of the late Sarah Elizabeth Kennedy called "Skin".
